p: MaxEnt, one of the most popular machine algorithms, is designed for modeling the geographical distribution of species from the n‐dimensional environmental variables spaces with presence‐only data (Phillips et al., 2006). A 10‐fold cross‐validation procedure, which is preferable to penalty functions for assessing model generality, was implemented to replicate model runs and data partitions (Merow et al., 2013). It holds out 10% of the data as a testing set at each of 10 iterations, training the model on the remaining 90% of the data in each iteration. Other specified parameters and their setting are maximum number of background points = 10,000, Maximum iterations = 1,000, Convergence threshold = 0.00001, prevalence = 0.5.
